name: Comfort Inn at Maplewood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel en route from the US to Canada. It was OK but definitely not worth the rate charged. The decor is dated, the furniture worn. Fortunately, the staff is friendly and helpful and made up for some of the shortcomings. In spite of the free breakfast, I can't say that we would be in a great hurry to go back.
reviews.title: OK to crash for one night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were spending a week in Vermont and had spent a couple of nights in a much much much more expensive hotel in the Stowe area. We will take this Comfort Inn over that facility any time.
reviews.title: Very Impressed

reviews.text: Desk folks at check in were super friendly. Room was very nice - and absolutley spotless. Soda and cookies available for the taking. Desk clerk called the room a few minutes after we checked in to make sure everything was satisfactory.
reviews.title: A+++ front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Continental breakfast sort of typical but also had fresh waffles (with real maple syrup - after all this is Vermont) and scrambled eggs and bacon so better than many.
reviews.title: Delightful stay

reviews.text: Would totally recommed if you are looking for an outstanding motel in the Montpelier area.
reviews.title: Nice, but....

reviews.text: Great location. Only 5 minutes from Montpelier center and about 20 miles from Stowe. Outstanding service at front desk. Good bang for the buck.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: We stayed here during a snow storm which after a spin out on I89 on the way to Stowe, made us stop short of our destination. This hotel is just off the I89 exit.
reviews.title: Refuge from the storm

reviews.text: This place was a real value, wi fi, small work out area, lounge with board games and computers and a continental plus type breakfast. An applebees across the street delivers. Place was comfy, clean and warm.
reviews.title: best kept secret

reviews.text: Staff was pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Affordable, Pleasant

reviews.text: This place is quite comfortable! Real Maple syrup included in the continental breakfast.... Nothing bad to say here.
reviews.title: nice people, nice property

reviews.text: In the past, my family opted to stay in White River Junction, mainly due to the lack to hotels with consistent good reviews in Barre/Montpelier and wanting to avoid the high prices in Burlington/Stowe. Having noticed that the Comfort Inn @ Maplewood was now #1 in the area, we decided to give it a shot. We’re really glad we did.
reviews.title: Smart choice!

reviews.text: The front desk staff was exceptionally friendly, helpful and accommodating of our small family reunion. Having stayed at a very wide variety of hotels over the years, I tend to assume mid-level price means you get mid-level service and comfort. Not here. I think the gentleman at the front desk (Sam?) when we checked in set the great tone for the weekend. Great front desk staff there…
reviews.title: Clean, but outdated

reviews.text: The hotel is very easy to get to off the highway. But, its far enough that you won’t hear any highway noise. There is an Applebees and deli/gas station next door to the hotel and a Shaw’s grocery store across the street. (Note to people traveling with young kids: there is an elementary school ¼ mile away with a big field and playground and a McDonalds with an indoor playland 5-10mins away.) It really is a great location. Even if you’re spending most of the time in Stowe or Burlington – rooms cost more there. This is a great option if you don’t mind driving a few extra miles.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: We had a suite with a kitchenette which included: microwave, small fridge, sink, silverware and dish soap (nice touch). I assume the suite was recently updated. The carpet, furniture, fixtures all looked new ( I think the window treatments are still waiting for an upgrade). The room was VERY clean and stocked with everything you’d expect. PLUS, complimentary bottled water. The bedding was new and mattress was comfy. The living room area and the bedroom both had big HD flatscreen TVs. Another hotel perk: they serve warm chocolate chip cookies around 3pm in the lobby, along with a big pitcher of milk. The lobby also has coffee and a small fridge with soda that guests are welcome to. The free breakfast is from 6am-10am and is much better than your average free hotel breakfast: scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage, bagels, toast, Danish, yogurt, juice, coffee and a Belgian waffle station with real maple syrup.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only “critiques” for the sake of a balanced review: a few in our group seemed to have problems with the magnetic strips on the room cards. We’d have to swipe it a dozen times, various speeds, etc and eventually it’d work. We ended up getting replacement cards and had the same problem. Also, housekeeping did a great job having an immaculate room ready for our arrival. But, the room didn’t quite get the same level of attention on the second day (garbage bin not emptied, towels not re-stocked with any washcloths or hand towels, toiletries not restocked). But these were very minor inconveniences and I have no doubt the front desk would have resolved things if we pressed the issues.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, clean, large room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this place. Rate it in the 'above budget' class of chain hotels. Very very clean, free hot breakfast, free hot cookies and soda and coffee 24hrs.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Top notch staff!

reviews.text: Rooms were spacious and very very clean.
reviews.title: Very friendly Hotel!

reviews.text: Location was far from Montpelier itself....at the top of the hill outside of Barre - kind of an odd location, but the airport was not far away.
reviews.title: Great hospitality and friendly service

reviews.text: Place was kind of expensive given its class and being sort of in the middle of nowhere (Montpelier, VT), but got 10% AAA discount and noticed all hotels in the area were expensive for their class. The crap hotels were $60-90, and I'd rather pay the extra $35-40 than stay in mold.
reviews.title: Great spot for central Vermont traveler

reviews.text: I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Top notch place to stay

description: 89 tastefully appointed guest rooms including 18 two room suites. Complimentary hot breakfast with scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage and fresh waffles with Vermont maple syrup and much more to start your day! Complimentary wi-fi throughout. Each room is equipped with microwave, refrigerator, Kuerig coffee maker, hair dryer, iron, ironing board, safe and voice mail. Flat screen tv's in each room with HD channels. Free bottles of water and k-cups in each room. Free long distance calls to anywhere in the US or Canada in the lobby. 24 hour fitness center and guest laundry. Located next to Applebee's Restaurant and Maplewood Convenience Store & Deli.
